subtitle: [Music]
New Thinking Allowed. Conversations on the
leading edge
of knowledge and discovery with
parapsychologist
Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove.
Today I want to share
with you some of the comments that I
have deleted from the New Thinking Allowed
video channel comment section.
And I'm referring to the comments under
each video.
Let me start out by saying that in
general my philosophy is not to delete
comments, I would prefer never to have to
delete comments. One of the reasons is
that I like the idea
that the comments reflect the
collective consciousness of our viewers, a broad
spectrum of thoughts and ideas, opinions
and feelings that come across.
However, in fact I do delete comments and
I have that power because I own this
channel
and I use my own discretion which means
that to some degree it's capricious, to
some degree
it's inconsistent whether a comment gets
removed or not
may depend on just how busy I am
at any particular day. I think I've
mentioned many times
that I read all the comments, I just
don't have time
to respond to them all. I know there are
YouTubers
who do, they respond to each
and every
comment. I just can't
do that. But I have found some
comments absolutely must be deleted. I
don't have
any tolerance for racist comments.
Let me put it even more strongly, I
want this channel and all of the
comments to reflect
a sense of respect for all the
participants, so
when I see comments that are just out
and out nasty
and insulting I will delete them.
Now that doesn't mean you can't be
critical because there are many
thoughtful critical comments.
I may disagree with them or I find them
troubling or disturbing, maybe I have
to take them to heart because of that,
but some comments are simply an
expression of disgust without any real
thought put into them. This is after all
New Thinking Allowed so if you have a
critical comment
and you couch it in a thoughtful manner,
it's likely
not to be removed.
Here are some examples now of
comments that I have removed and I'm
gonna
put on my glasses so that I can read.
They're not in any particular order.
Here's a person who commented on
a beautiful discussion on consciousness
and cosmology. He said, “Terrible lecture,”
and [it] gave him a headache. Well, I can tell
you right now if the video
is giving you a headache or a stomachache,
take some medicine, go see a doctor. Just
telling me
about your physical complaints in that way
isn't going to get you very far. I'm
likely to delete
such a comment. Here's another one
and this person has posted multiple
times. There are spammers
of course who are promoting their own
ideas, their own websites and so on. Here's
somebody called “Art
king” who has posted multiple times:
“Check out the canvas paintings of divine
consciousness”.
Normally, if you want to promote
something
and it's something positive and
something related
to the videos I will allow that once or twice
but if it becomes a nuisance, if you're
constantly
posting spam like that you're going to
get deleted and at some point
I might even block you from the channel
altogether. I'll tell you this, if you put
blatantly
racist and hostile comments on you will
get blocked
from the channel. After all, we have over
80,000 subscribers,
I don't need the nuisance people,
I can easily block people from this
channel completely
if comments become hostile
and negative. Like, here’s somebody,
this one is almost
funny but it’s not really, he says
“F**k all humans that don't appreciate
and love their animals.”
It was unnecessary, I think maybe it was
trying to be cute but
trying to be cute sometimes does not
work very well. Now, let me say this about
politics, I've been very clear for a long time
with my viewers. I am a lifelong
Liberal Democrat. That is my political
bias, I never tried to hide it. But,
in general, we don't talk about politics
on this channel.
I talk about parapsychology, spirituality,
philosophy, psychology, health, science
and culture. I, in general, try to avoid
current events, but from time to time
they will come up,
from time to time my bias will show.
I think viewers know that I'm open to
discussions with people who don't share
my particular biases.
Jason Reza Jorjani for example is
one of my favorite guests on the New
Thinking Allowed channel
and his politics are very, very different
from mine.
But he is willing to discuss politics
respectfully and thoughtfully and I
admire that wherever it comes from. But, I
have viewers who, for example in the recent
series with Glenn Aparicio Parry,
who is writing about politics mostly
from the perspective of
indigenous people and Native Americans,
where there is respect for both
the conservative and the liberal points
of view. But
some of you, I think maybe you’re
followers of Jason
for all I know, you're right wingers and
you get terribly offended at
anything that might even be slightly critical
of right wing politics that you host, and so
you respond with vitriol. Like
this person who says, “With all due
respect, this was just another one sided
leftist
circle jerk, poisonous to common sense,”
and ends up by calling us all “Commies.”
That's going to get deleted when
you talk that way.
Be respectful. People who disagree with
you about politics
aren’t all “Commies” or aren’t all evil or
aren't all stupid.
And there was quite a lot of that frankly
and it comes primarily, but not exclusively,
from the right. Here's a person who
watched a video having to do with
near death experience
and says, “This person should read
the Bible,” and “Please
tell her to do that.” Well,
if you're here to propagandize
for one religion or another also
that's likely to be deleted.
Here's another person who
in responding to a political post talks
about “a Marxist
infection that has lasted for over a
century and it is a deadly
virus.”
That kind of talk really rankles me.
I have to say this,
if you think that you understand the
source of evil in the world, I have three
words for you, look inside yourself.
That's where you will find the devil
residing. People who think they can
identify
the source of evil that is plaguing
humanity... Really?
It doesn't belong on this channel. I
think I've been very clear
about my perspective. I embrace the whole
universe, there is no part of the
universe that is
unentangled from me and
frankly, I think unentangled from you too.
Here's a comment that got deleted, “I
hate Jello.” Well, it's just totally silly and
totally irrelevant, has nothing to do
with the talk,
unless it was some attempt at being cute
and nasty.
Here's a person who says they don't like
to see me smiling because
it makes their face hurt. Well,
if you've got a problem with your face
go see a doctor or take an aspirin, don't
tell me about it.
Here are comments that are totally
irrelevant,
but political diatribes about the New World
Order and why we've got to get rid of
them or
why everybody needs to learn about the
Zelenko Protocol, or how come
all products are made in China? And
how about the mainstream media
talking points because everybody knows
the mainstream media has been proven to
be corrupt and they lie daily.
That's not an intelligent conversation,
it's a diatribe. I rarely
range into politics but I hope that when
I do, it's not a diatribe. Here's one who
talks about “woo.” He said, “New Age woo,
dear me.” If you think
that I'm putting up New Age woo on this
channel I'm happy to hear you give your
reasons why. If you think that
some of my guests are phony or they're
faking or they're lying,
don't just insult them. Tell me why
you think you can justify
that kind of talk, it probably will be
kept up. Any sort of thoughtful critique
is welcome even if it disagrees with me.
I welcome disagreements,
as a matter of fact, I think that's how
we learn.
But when it gets to the point of simply,
you know, it's like you want to barf on
the comment section.
I'm sorry if you're having indigestion but
that's not what New Thinking Allowed is
for. Let me continue on.
Here we have somebody who says, “Leftism
is a disease.”
Well, so is rightism a disease?
Here's a person who responded to
another person who they were having a
dispute... You know,
sometimes what happens is a person puts
a comment in the comment section, one of
the
kind that I think don't really belong in
the comment section,
but other viewers respond and it leads
to what could be a thoughtful interesting
discussion,
or at least a debate of some sort.
When that happens I often leave it
up, I figure I don't need to delete it
because other viewers have already
called this person
out. But in this case that particular
person responded
by saying, “Thanks professor,”
which was meant in a condescending
tone like,
“Who are you to talk to me like that? Are
you a professor?”
Treat each other with respect even if
you disagree. Don't
condescend to me or to my guests
or to each other in the comment section
and chances are your comment won’t be
deleted because
I want a vibrant comment section, I truly do.
Here’s someone who writes, “These liberals
are the least
self aware individuals on the planet,
typical leftist garbage.” It wasn't
leftist garbage, it was
a program by Glenn Parry which was very
respectful in my opinion of both right wing
conservative and liberal positions.
But a balanced point of view, for some of
you, is considered leftist garbage. You're
entitled to your opinion but if you
can't express it more eloquently than that
on this channel in the comment section
it'll get deleted.
You know, often I get
people who say this,
“I love your channel. I've been watching
it for years but this
is s**t.”
I sometimes leave them up because I
think that you're trying to be balanced,
you’re trying to be nice
but frankly praising me or praising the
channel
and then saying something really
unjustified and really nasty about a guest
or a topic that we're covering can very
likely get you deleted.
So this person writes, “A trash interview
on a channel that
is mostly gold.” Oh, I appreciate that
you think the channel is mostly gold
and sure, I do have a bias. If you say, “I
hate the channel,” with no
justification I’ll probably delete it. If
you say, “I love
the channel,” with no justification
I'll probably leave it up.
Here's a person who says, I think this is
with regard to spoon bending and remote
viewing, it says,
“I'm so glad you brought the military
into this. It shows you have no morals,
no ethics and don't care what psi is
used for.” Now, I have to say this.
I’m not critiquing all the grammatical
errors and misspellings, I know there are
YouTube
channels that do that, they read the
comments and make fun of all the errors,
but I happen to know that half of our
viewers come from outside the United
States and English may not be
your first language or maybe you didn't
have as much formal education as I have
had, so you misspell words.
Very, very common and that is not going
to get you removed
from the comment section.
But if all you want to do is say I have
no morals because I
talk about a topic in a way that you
don't like. Really?
Here's a person who
is talking about one of our guests who
says, “Just the biggest collection of
pseudo-scientific nonsense
I have ever seen.” Well maybe it was,
but if all you can do is insult it
without really explaining in some detail
why you have such a harsh judgment,
delete. Here is a person who
is trying to promote a conspiracy
theory,
“Utmost respect Mr. Mishlove. I have been a
long time
follower and this comment is off topic but
why aren't you talking about the ongoing
corona virus?
All this intellectualizing and musing
and deducing and philosophizing
and the entire humanity is being
brainwashed.
This bothers me because I think we
should not just keep our head in the
sand like ostriches and pretend it is all
well. It is not.” Well,
if you think all of humanity is being
brainwashed,
that's a pretty strong statement and
it doesn't belong here when it's in
response to
a video that has nothing to do with it.
And frankly, you know, you're promoting a
right wing
conspiracy theory, you might as well be
propagandizing
for a religion.
I really think healthy discussion is
important but
just name calling and acting
outraged isn't going to get you
into our discussion section for the
most part.
Here's a person who says “You,” referring
to me, “are the master of blending
absolute horse-s**t with absolute cools**t.”
You know, I almost took that as a
compliment. I like the “cool-s**t” part
but, really, if you think something on this
channel is
absolute horse-s**t, I am telling you it's
incumbent upon you
to explain in a thoughtful way why
and I most likely will leave that
comment.
Here's a person who posted a comment,
it's mostly an intelligent comment, it
just uses the word s**t
over a dozen times.
If what you think is that
kind of potty-mouth language is so
juvenile
I found it offensive and I deleted it.
That gets you through my list basically.
I hope
that I haven't just been going on a rant
of my own. My goal is to
make the comment section something that
everybody will find
of benefit because it will be full of
thoughtful comments whether you agree
with them or disagree with them, it might
inspire you to think more deeply.
So let me leave you with this
question, if you were going to post
a really thoughtful comment on one of
our videos
what would it be? What would your
thoughtful post be about?
Thank you for being with me.
[Music]
